@ClintEhrlich @Cardano_ Will this be open source?

@ClintEhrlich @Cardano_ Cryptocurrencies are living systems that are ultimately built from social consensus. They will be upgraded and each time this happens you reset the constant presence milestone.
@ClintEhrlich @Cardano_ No because we can always periodically checkpoint the chain and this is usually done at the time of a hard fork. Deep reorganizations are never accepted in practice.

@ClintEhrlich @Cardano_ For example assume there are two chains A and B with roughly the same hash power and PoW algorithm. Assume one actor has enough hash power to 51 percent attack them. Its rational to goldfinger A and then switch to honestly mining B. This attack can be repeated unlimited times

@ClintEhrlich @Cardano_ We do have some research we are doing about recovery options from dishonest majority, but this is a separate problem. You are assuming that an honest minority or miners will eventually regain control of the network with PoW. This isn't necessary true.

@ClintEhrlich @Cardano_ The assumption of constant presence is from when you launch the genesis block. You wait until a reasonable distribution has occurred and marketcap is sufficient high. Then you treat the hard fork as the new genesis block

@ClintEhrlich @Cardano_ You build protocols in iterations and layers. We replicated operational equivalence with PoW via the Ouroboros research line. Bootstrap equivalence wasn't in scope as these systems are fundamentally different in distribution and launch assumptions

@ClintEhrlich @Cardano_ You are conflating bootstrap problems with the ongoing operational problems of the system. All protocols suffer numerous bootstrap issues as many new PoW getting 51 percent attacked demonstrate. You have to wait some time for the social dynamics and network investment to stablize

@ClintEhrlich @Cardano_ The practical way to launch a PoS system is the same as a new PoW system. You have a piggyback BFT protocol that is trusted until you reach a critical mass then switch to decentralization. Price or Hash rate are the key metrics here
@ClintEhrlich @Cardano_ Half a billion dollars. We are still running Ouroboros in a federated mode. When genesis is launched we are checkpointed from the time of the hard fork.

@udiWertheimer @ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R When we can run this https://t.co/VmFZvZFb5f

@udiWertheimer @ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R Technology like Avalanche and IPFS are required to have this type of conversation and it's at least a half decade off if the model even proves to be cost competitive.

@udiWertheimer @ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R The DApp model is a failure. Proposing to blindly replace a server with something a thousand times slower and more expensive and also operating in a replicated environment is reckless and the result of Tual and others after my time

@udiWertheimer @ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R The real value Ethereum brought to the table is a global conversation about Assets, their representation, movement and how to understand the intent behind terms and conditions of their possession and transaction. There is a profound richness

@udiWertheimer @ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R The very fact that the ICO exists is a sufficient reason. Modeling complex financial relationships between untrusted actors is a tremendously valuable pursuit. Adding in a discussion about the environments these relationships ought to run in is icing on the cake

@udiWertheimer @ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R Ethereum didn't need PoS in the beginning. The original point was to validate the smart contract model not also solve scalability. Once Ethereum reached market success, they should have committed millions to a dedicated scalability project

@udiWertheimer @ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R He has friends at Cornell, over a billion dollars in capital to deploy and hundreds willing to collaborate and help. There is no defense. Snow White frankly should have been the foundations of Casper. Elaine has done a great job there

@udiWertheimer @ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R It's important to have a team of good people. Some workhorses, some experienced, some domain experts for particular aspects of the protocol. Then have a good process to vet the claims and test it at scale. Peer Review helps here

@udiWertheimer @ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R No, Bram Cohen does amazing work for example. It's not about the credentials, its about the domain skill. It takes about a decade to get good at protocol design and lots of failures. PhDs help with the research process and accessing the right people to collaborate with

@ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R I purposely left my linkedin page sparse to prove a point. Credentials are meaningless here in the space. An anonymous person built the foundations we stand on. We ought to focus on the work, not the people
@brunolarvol I got in through the neckbeard haskell exemption.

@ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R I graduated but did not complete a PhD. I will return and finish it after I retire. I also studied a topic that has nothing to do with Cryptocurrencies (Number Theory) any credentials there wouldn't be applicable to protocol development or software engineering
@cryptomifi @ummjackson It doesn't and it never has. You build things with teams of people each bringing specialized skills to a common goal. If you want a wheelbarrow of degrees, go to faketoshi.

@ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R Computer Science is one of the most efficient and industry focused of all the STEMs with professors usually consulting on real life projects and contributing to open source projects. It isn't an Ivory tower. The process is built to get ideas into production.

@ummjackson @Daneel_Olivaw_R I don't write protocols. This requires usually more than a decade of dedicated experience and extensive specialized training. My criticism of Vitalik is that he has completely disregarded the established process in the computer science world and decided to do everything in house

@ummjackson @sudogene People impersonate me all the time. There is even a dedicate parody account on twitter. Unless it comes from a video or my official twitter account stay skeptical. IOHK is a credential agnostic company. We hire professors and high school drop outs. It's about merit
@ummjackson Nope no PhD. I leave the science to the science people who dedicated a large chunk of their lives to it.
